group_1.textCenter: ("Even should the adults forgive you, I never will.")
("Regardless of Juvenile Law, I will personally@crush you...")
(These venomous words were written again and@again by members of the Eradication Faction...)
(I didn't really pay them any mind.)
(But the scribbling on my shoes and the dumping@of food in them was unexpected...)

group_1.narration: We're not well-off by any means.
My father died when I was young, but my mother@worked hard to manage the inn on her own...
It's because I've witnessed that pain of hers@up close, that these acts hurt me the most...
No matter what you do to me, it won't hurt,@but when you damage something my mother@bought for me, it hurts to see the pain@on her face...

group_1.textCenter: (Darn it, my Soul Gem is getting murky...@I must freeze my heart...)

group_1.textLeft: Hey, wait.@What kind of bullying is that nowadays?
Don't you think it's pretty cruel...?

group_1.textRight: About that chick, she showed up as a guest on@Nightlife Homeroom the other day.
She came forward and admitted responsibility,@y'know, for the fatal Festival accident recently.
I heard there's one hell of a grudge against her.
I dunno what you're thinking, but if you get@involved, you'll be a target too...

group_1.textCenter: (Yes, staying uninvolved is the correct move...)
(I'm just a punching bag, silently absorbing anger@and sadness...)

group_1.narration: i apologize.@my movements will be hindered@if we appear too close,@so i've chosen to adopt giving@you the cold shoulder.
Don't worry about it.@If anything, I believe you're being watched@at school because you were defending us.@It's best not to get involved...

yes, in terms of numbers,@the advocates for magical girls are dwindling,@while the eradication groups are only increasing.@i apologize, himuro-senpai,@but we'll have to operate under the radar@for a while.

...I was hoping our declaration on@Nightlife Homeroom would bring all the hate@against the entire Magical Girl community@down to just the three of us, but to be honest,@it hasn't worked out as well as I'd hoped...

for the eradication faction, if they slack off now,@it would amount to admitting to the mass@slaughter of magical girls.@so even if you three are being targeted now,@their policy of eventually eliminating all@magical girls will remain unchanged.
And to think that there will be more incidents@caused by Witches in the future.@Once we're gone, they'll just find another@target to harass next...
i think you're right.@they've simply shifted from indiscriminately@targeting magical girls to focusing@their attacks on you.
For now, I'm okay.@I can withstand most of the mistreatment.
But it hurts my heart when family@and friends are involved.@And while the curses written on desks and@blackboards are tolerable,@the act of erasing them takes a toll on my psyche.
By erasing them, it feels as though I've@admitted to something I didn't do.
still, until we can find a solution...
Indeed, I have to endure it...

group_1.textRight: Will you stop contacting Himuro?@The next time I see you, I won't ignore it.

group_1.textCenter: (Yes, it's times like these that pierce my heart@the deepest of all...)
A little patience...just a little more patience...
